title: Understanding Variance
text: Variance is a measure of how much the values in a data set differ from the mean. In a Gaussian distribution, it is closely related to the standard deviation.

title: Relationship Between Variance and Standard Deviation
text: The variance is the square of the standard deviation. This means if you know the standard deviation, you can find the variance by squaring it.

title: Calculating Variance
text: If the standard deviation of a Gaussian distribution is \( \sigma \), what is the variance?

title: Common Misconceptions
text: Remember, variance is not the same as the mean or the range of the data. It specifically measures the spread of the data around the mean.

hintAnswer: It is the square of the standard deviation.
